title: insta-integration configuration schema
description: Configuration to run integration tests with insta-integration

env.description: Environment variables to be applied to all runs.

services.description: External services required to run integration tests

name.description: Name of the service. Optionally, define the version of the service to run using pattern '<service>:<version>'.

data.description: Folder path or link to startup files. For example, 'postgres/sql' folder with schema and table creation SQL files. Refer to insta-infra for possible startup files

run.description: Applications/jobs to run as part of the integration tests. Run in order.

command.description: Bash command to run your application/job.

commandWaitForFinish.description: Whether to wait for the command to finish before running data generation/validation.

generateFirst.description: Whether to run data generation before your application/job runs.

test.description: Data Caterer configuration for data generation and validation

env.description: Environment variables for data-caterer Docker image. Check 'src/config.js' baseApplicationConf for potential environment variables to override.

generation.description: Define data sources along with schemas for data generation.

additionalProperties.description: Array of data generation tasks with the data source name as the key.

items.description: Data generation task details with information about data source, number of records and schema.

options.description: Data source configuration for data generation.

metadataSourceType.description: Type of metadata source for retrieval of schema information.

schemaLocation.description: Location of OpenAPI spec file (can be a URL or file pathway).

count.description: Define the number of records to generate.

records.description: Total number of records to generate.

options.description: Random number of records defined by metadata in options.

perField.description: Generate records per unique set of field values. For example, generate 5 transactions for each 'account_number'.

fieldNames.description: Array of field names to generate records for each set of unique values.

items.description: Field name found within schema fields.

count.description: Static number of records per unique set of field values.

options.description: Random number of records per unique set of field values.

dbtable.description: Name of the schema and table to connect to (<schema>.<table> format).

partitions.description: Number of file partitions to create.

partitionBy.description: Field name(s) to partition dataset by (comma separated).

rowsPerSecond.description: Number of records to create per second.
Number of records to create per second.

mount.description: Add volume mount for data-caterer Docker image.

relationship.description: Define any relationships between data generation data sources. For example, 'account_number' field being the same across two Postgres tables accounts and balances.

items.description: Uses the pattern: '<name of generation>.<field name>' or '<name of data source>.<name of generation>.<field name>'

validation.description: Define data sources along with validation rules to run after data generation and your application/job.

additionalProperties.description: Array of data validation tasks with the data source name as the key.

enabledEdgeCase.description: Enable generating edge case values for data type.

edgeCaseProb.description: Probability of generating edge case values. Range from 0-1.

seed.description: Seed for generating consistent random values.

sql.description: Spark SQL expression for generating data.

oneOf.description: Generated values will be one of the defined values.

omit.description: Exclude the field from the final output. Can be used for intermediate data generation.

nullProbability.description: Probability of generating null values. Range from 0-1.

distributionRateParam.description: If distribution is `exponential`, rate parameter to adjust exponential distribution.

incremental.description: Generate incremental numbers. By default, starts at 1. You can define a starting number.

uuid.description: Generate UUID values. If non-empty, you can define another column name to generate UUID values from another columns value.

incremental.description: Generate incremental numbers. By default, starts at 1. You can define a starting number.

static.description: Field is only equal to a static value.

ValidationDescription.description: Description of the validation rule. Helpful to provide additional context.

ValidationErrorThreshold.description: Define the number of records or percentage of records that do not meet the validation rule before marking the validation as failed.

ValidationPreFilterExpression.description: SQL expression that is run to filter data before running the validation.

ValidationExpression.description: SQL expression to define validation. Check https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/sql for reference.

ValidationSelectExpression.description: SQL expression used to apply to fields before running validations.

ValidationAggregateExpression.description: SQL expression to define validation after aggregation. Check https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/sql for reference.

ValidationAggregateField.description: Field name to run aggregation on.

ValidationAggregateType.description: Type of aggregation to run. Can be either: sum, avg, max, min, mean, stddev, count.

ValidationAggregateGroupByFields.description: Field names to group by for aggregation calculation.

ValidationUpstreamJoinFields.description: Field names to run join operation on.

ValidationUpstreamDataSource.description: Name of the upstream data source.

ValidationUpstreamReadOptions.description: Additional configuration to connect to upstream data source.

ValidationUpstreamNestedValidations.description: Validation to run after join with upstream data source.

ValidationFieldNameType.description: Type of field name validation to run.

FieldValidationType.description: Type of field validation to run on field.

FieldValidationStrictly.description: Strictly compare the value. For example, if set to false for lessThan, the comparison will be <=.

value.description: Value to check if field contains.

values.description: List of data types to check for.

regexes.description: List of regex patterns to match against.

field.description: Field name to run validation on.

validation.description: List of validation rules to run on the field.
